byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and LORI ROTENBERK

lead_paragraph: The lawsuit was brought by the owner of a work and an art dealer, who accused Mr. Doig of falsely denying that he had created it.

headline.print_headline: Judge Rules That Plaintiff Was Wrong: His Landscape Is Not a Peter Doig
headline.main: The Artist Peter Doig Wins a Case Involving a Painting’s Attribution

snippet: The lawsuit was brought by the owner of a work and an art dealer, who accused Mr. Doig of falsely denying that he had created it....
abstract: Federal Judge Gary Feinerman in Chicago rules that artist Peter Doig did not paint 40-year-old landscape and is not responsible for scuttling plans by Canadian Robert Fletcher, current owner of painting, to sell it for millions of dollars; Fletcher's suit had accused Doig of falsely denying he had created work as young artist.
